attributes.action: Lower MPs wages to minimum wage and axe expenses altogether.
attributes.additional_details: MPs are supposed to work for their constituents but they only work for their highest donors. Its time MPs wages are heavily reduced to reflect the work they do for their constituents or lack there of.
attributes.background: MPs wages should reflect the work they do for the electorate. They should be given minimum wage until a time the electorate decides they deserve a payrise. They should not be able to claim any expenses and imprisonment should be given, if they are found taking "donations" from big business.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
